alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Custer (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 1:53PM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Idaho, including the following counties, Blaine and Custer. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms between Ketchum and the southern end of the Stanley Basin, especially around Galena Summit. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Quick rises on area streams and creeks are also possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Galena Lodge, Galena Summit and Smiley Creek Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
